newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish troops kill 17 rebel Kurds in southeast.
newsitem.headline: Turkish troops kill 17 rebel Kurds in southeast.

text.p: Turkish troops killed 17 Kurdish guerrillas on Saturday in southeastern Turkey, the semi-official Anatolian news agency said.

It said eight members of the Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) were shot dead in an operation, launched after nine Turkish soldiers and a state-paid village guard were killed by a landmine, planted by rebels, in the southeastern town of Midyat.
The soldiers and the guard were killed when their military patrol vehicle hit the landmine late on Friday.
The agency said two PKK members surrendered during the clash.
Nine other PKK guerrillas have been killed in other clashes in the southeastern towns of Tatvan, Guroymak, Besiri, Sason, Ozalp and Kulp.
The agency did not say when the clashes took place.
The PKK has been fighting for autonomy or independence in the region since 1984. More than 24,000 people have been killed since then.
